title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
(i)

1 point is earned: For a correct expression for momentum

p = mv

pi=(0.2kg)(3.0 m/s)

1 point is earned: For the correct answer

pi = 0.6kg * m/s

(ii)

1 point is earned: For a correct expression for kinetic energy

K = ½ mv2

Ki = ½(0.2 kg)(3.0 m/s)2

1 point is earned: For the correct answer

Ki = 0.9J

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
(i)

1 point is earned : For any statement of conservation of momentum

p f = p i

1 point is earned : For the correct answer

p f = 0.6kg * m/s

(ii)

Knowing the final momentum, the final velocity can be calculated

p f = m f v f

v f = p f / m f

= 0.6 k g · m / s ( 1.3 + 0.2 ) k g

1 point is earned : For the correct value of the final velocity

v f = 0.4 m/s

Using the expression for kinetic energy

K f = ½m f v f 2

1 point is earned : For using the sum of the two masses

K f = ½(1.5kg)(0.4 m/s) 2

1 point is earned : For the correct answer

K f = 0.12J
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

(i)

1 point is earned: For any statement of conservation of momentum

pf = pi

1 point is earned: For the correct answer

pf = 0.6kg * m/s

(ii)

Knowing the final momentum, the final velocity can be calculated

pf = mfvf

vf = pf / mf

= 0.6 k g · m / s ( 1.3 + 0.2 ) k g

1 point is earned: For the correct value of the final velocity

vf = 0.4 m/s

Using the expression for kinetic energy

Kf = ½mfvf2

1 point is earned: For using the sum of the two masses

Kf = ½(1.5kg)(0.4 m/s)2

1 point is earned: For the correct answer

Kf = 0.12J

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned : For any statement of conservation of energy

The kinetic energy after the impact is equal to the maximum energy stored in the spring.

K f = ½ kA 2

Solving for the amplitude of the motion:

A = 2 K f / k

1 point is earned : For substituting the answer to (b)ii for the kinetic energy

A = 2 ( 0.12 J ) / ( 100 N / m )

1 point is earned : For the correct answer

A = 0.05 m

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned : For the correct expression for the period

T = 2 π m / k T = 2 π ( 1.5 k g ) ( 100 N / m )

1 point is earned : For the correct answer

T = 0.77 s
descriptions:

title: Units points
stimulusHtml: 1 point is earned: For having both one correct energy unit and one correct momentum unit on answers in parts (a) and (b), and no incorrect units.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned: For having both one correct energy unit and one correct momentum unit on answers in parts (a) and (b), and no incorrect units.
